definition: to lift/to raise in height/to begin/upsurge/to set off (a campaign)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Hot summer days are coming while the high-grade summer goods will raise another heat wave.
sentences.chinese: 伏天将临，夏日精晶将掀起又一个热季狂潮。

sentences.english: How come, the branches irritated the jealous wind and messed up the pond?
sentences.chinese: 何以会有，那树枝，掀起了妒火中烧的秋风？

sentences.english: A lift your veil, once touched many hearts.
sentences.chinese: 一首掀起你的盖头来，曾打动了多少美好的心灵。

sentences.english: The evidence was flimsy, and a campaign was launched to secure a re-trial.
sentences.chinese: 由于证据不足，掀起了一场为取得复审的运动。

sentences.english: In a piece titled "How Did England Mount the Green Wave?
sentences.chinese: 在一篇名为“英国是如何掀起绿色变革的？”

sentences.english: Among lolich the material is always the one to start the fashion reform.
sentences.chinese: 而每一次掀起服装改革浪潮的都是面料。

sentences.english: This event caused a wave of indignation in Sweden.
sentences.chinese: 此事件在瑞典掀起了怒涛。

sentences.english: Was not the love we found worth the tempest that it boomed?
sentences.chinese: 难道我们的爱不值得它所掀起的轩然风暴？

sentences.english: Apparently, the article has inspired heated back-and-forths on industry e-mail lists.
sentences.chinese: 显然，文章在业内的电邮名单中掀起了惊涛骇浪。

sentences.english: Her straight sets victory in Paris also set off a wave of exuberant patriotism in the press at home.
sentences.chinese: 她在巴黎直落三盘的胜利也掀起了家乡的一波。

sentences.english: President Rogge’s interview on Weibo also created waves offline.
sentences.chinese: 罗格主席的在线访谈也在线下掀起了高潮。

sentences.english: A strong head wind lashed the river into waves.
sentences.chinese: 一股顶头风在河中掀起了波浪。

sentences.english: Musharraf has unilaterally amended the constitution at the beginning of the week and caused strong objections and noises.
sentences.chinese: 穆夏拉夫本周初片面修改宪法，掀起极大的反弹声浪。

sentences.english: Thus the whole society should endeavor to promote a new fashion of simple weddings.
sentences.chinese: 因此，全社会都应该掀起简单婚礼的新时尚。

sentences.english: A metal probe lifts the septum secundum and reveals the opening.
sentences.chinese: 一根金属探针将房间隔掀起以显示未闭开放。

sentences.english: The wind that blows the dry steppe dust. Stirs the curtains in your tower.
sentences.chinese: 大风卷袭着草原的尘土，掀起塔楼上的窗帘。

definition: tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
to engulf/to sweep/to carry away everything
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
to arouse/to evoke/to cause/to stir up
lit. foul wind and bloody rain (idiom)/fig. reign of terror/carnage
to surge like a gathering storm (idiom)/to grow by leaps and bounds
billows/great waves (fig. of a story with great momentum)
to cause a sensation/to create a stir in (a place)/commotion/controversy
to lead to/to trigger/to initiate/to cause/to evoke (emotions)
